textboxes.description: You stand before an abstract creature, a swirling mass of shifting colors and light. It speaks to you, though no words are formed, only emotions and thoughts pass through your mind. 'Help me,' it says, but there’s a strange undertone. You feel a deep sense of both fear and empathy.

choices.text: Help the creature, despite your fear
Refuse to help, fearing what it may ask for

textboxes.description: You decide to help the creature, offering it your energy. As you do, you feel your strength ebb away. The creature absorbs it with an unsettling calm. But just before you collapse, it releases a burst of light that heals you completely. It has taken something from you, but given something back.

choices.text: Accept the trade, grateful for the healing
Demand the creature return what it took

textboxes.description: You refuse to help, unsure of the creature’s intentions. It seems to understand and pulls back, its light dimming. But as it fades, a wave of regret washes over you. You wonder if you made the right choice or if it was a chance for growth lost.

choices.text: Walk away, trying to forget the encounter
Return to the creature and offer your help

textboxes.description: You demand that the creature return what it took from you. It hesitates, and then, with a burst of emotion, it releases the energy back into you. But it seems angered, its colors darkening, and you sense that trust has been broken.

choices.text: Thank the creature, though wary of its anger
Walk away, leaving the creature behind

textboxes.description: You leave the encounter, the weight of your decision lingering. The abstract creature may never be understood, but you are left to ponder if the balance of fear and trust was ever truly in your hands.
